title: Confirmation Bias
content: Confirmation bias makes you seek information that supports what you already believe and dismiss information that contradicts it. In operations, this causes you to see what you expect rather than what's actually there. Fight it by actively seeking disconfirming evidence and asking 'what would change my mind?'

mcq.question: You believe a system is operating normally. A reading seems slightly off but could be instrument error. What should you do?

options.A: Assume instrument error since the system is normal
options.B: Investigate the anomaly as if your assumption might be wrong
options.C: Wait to see if other readings confirm the problem

mcq.explanation: Confirmation bias would have you dismiss the anomaly. Fighting it means investigating as if your assumption of normal operation could be wrong.

openQuestions: Describe a time when confirmation bias affected your assessment.
What techniques do you use to counteract confirmation bias?
